Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: UNCTAD. In December 2011, I contributed to the preparation of the “Trade and Development Report 2012” for UNCTAD; along with Prof. Giovanni Andrea Cornia, I was in charge of writing a quantitative paper on Inequality and Development.
World Bank. Between December 2013 and June 2014, I contributed to the analysis of the latest Ghana Living Standard Survey 6 (GLSS6) for the World Bank.
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Impact evaluation analysis of the Kenya CT-OVC programme
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. I contributed to the data collection and evaluation design of the Malawi's Social Cash Transfer (SCT) scheme.

University of Antwerp. Along with Donghyun Park and Marco Sanfilippo, I was in charge of writing a quantitative paper on structural transformation and inequality in Asia, "Catching Up, Structural Transformation, and Inequality: Lessons from Asia".

UNU-WIDER. I was in charge of writing a paper on the redistributive impact of taxation in developing countries with a special focus in Latin America, “Taxation and inequality in developing countries: Lessons from the recent experience of Latin America”
UNU – WIDER. Along with Patricia Justino, I was in charge of writing a paper on horizontal inequality and social mobility in Mexico, "Redistribution, inequality and political participation".
International Budget Partnership (IBP). I`m in charge of writing a paper on income taxation and tax expenditure in Latin America
Swiss Development Cooperation & Institute of Development Studies. I`m in charge of writing a paper on inequality and protest

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: “Overcoming Persistent Inequality and Poverty”. Queen Elizabeth House, University of Oxford, Oxford (UK)
4th ISCI International Conference: “Child Indicators in a Globalized World: Implications for Research, Practice and Policy”, Seoul (South Korea)
21st International Conference on Issues in Social Security, Sigtuna (Sweden)
1st SITES – IDEAS Conference, University of Florence (Italy)
Conference on Crises and the Distribution, Berlin Brandenburg Academy of Science, Berlin (Germany)
55th Annual Conference of the Italian Economic Association, University of Trento (Italy)
2nd SITES – IDEAS Conference, University of Florence (Italy)
10th African Economic Conference: “Addressing Poverty and Inequality in the Post 2015 Development Agenda”, Kinshasa (Democratic Republic of Congo) (INVITED SPEAKER IN PLENARY SESSION).
The Dynamics of Inequalities and their Perception (DynIPer) Conference, GREQAM - Marseille (France)
States, Markets and Society - IDS 50th Conference, Institute of Development Studies, University of Sussex, Brighton (UK) (INVITED SPEAKER)
Models and Policies for Human Development and Sustainable Growth - Third SITES/IDEAS Annual Conference, University of Florence (ITALY)
AQMeN International Conference on Rediscovering Inequalities, Edinburgh (UK)

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Postdoctoral Fellow at the Institute of Development Studies (IDS)
Teaching at the Institute of Development Studies. I was in charge to teach a class on inequality to economists from Cairo University
Teaching at the Institute of Development Studies. I was in charge to teach a class on policies for dealing with inequality at a group of master student at the Institute of Development Studies

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: UNU–WIDER’s Research Project on “The new policy model, inequality and poverty in Latin America”. Role: Researcher

UNDP’s project “Inequality in Sub-Saharan Africa". Since December 2014, I have been working on a new research project to analyze the evolution and determinants of income inequality in sub-Saharan African countries. Role: Researcher

The World Social Science Report 2015 - 2016: “Challenging Inequalities: Pathways to a Just World”. Funding institutions: the International Social Science Council (ISSC). Total project value:€ 227,787. Role: Researcher. more information available at: http://www.ids.ac.uk/project/the-world-social-science-report-2015-2016

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Visiting PhD Student, Centro de Investigaciones Económicas (CINVE) – Montevideo, Uruguay. To carry out the last part of my PhD thesis, I went to CINVE in Montevideo (Uruguay) and worked close with a number of economists involved in the reform design.
Visiting Fellow at the Institute of Development Studies (IDS) – University of Sussex, Brighton (UK)
Research Associate at the Consortium pour la recherche économique et sociale (CRES) - Dakar, Senegal
